definitions.text: an instrument with a handle and a flexible lash that is used for whipping
a legislator appointed by the party to enforce discipline
a dessert made of sugar and stiffly beaten egg whites or cream and usually flavored with fruit
(golf) the flexibility of the shaft of a golf club
a quick blow delivered with a whip or whiplike object
examples: the whip raised a red welt

definitions.text: beat severely with a whip or rod
examples: The teacher often flogged the students
He mopped up the floor with his opponents

definitions.text: thrash about flexibly in the manner of a whiplash
examples: The tall grass whipped in the wind

definitions.text: whip with or as if with a wire whisk

examples: The Senator blistered the administration in his speech on Friday
